<command-args>Q="We're engineering @/home/ubuntu/src/repos/Wiki/ which is a documentation automation github exploration software module whici we are trying to setup. It's basically going to be a scalable solution we can configure inside of GitHub. It's written in C, Katalyst React, & Julia. Basically; we're trying to engineer beautiful and expressive documentation for our Company Wiki & Production Documentation written for customers.So basically we check out a branch and write a PR and push it back to Prod which triggers reindexing of our repository. Now i think the best documentation is written in GitBook's style. Now we're only writing ASCII Diagrams. So mermaid diagrams are required to be converted. All docs are written in pure markdown this makes its a scalable solution for leveraging documentation. So yeah we merged 3 wikis together so please review the codebase and unify this. Our Typescript should be React 19's Katalyst which we can multithread. Now we're expected to install Julia in essentially all of our projects and we're bascally using the Genie Framework for creating the comprehensive Web Apps" model="opusplan"</command-args>

## [meta]

```json
{
  "agent_protocol_version": "2.0.0",
  "prompt_style": "multimodal-markdown",
  "intended_runtime": ["Anthropic Claude", "OpenAI GPT-4o", "Agentic System"],
  "schema_compatibility": ["json", "yaml", "markdown", "python", "shell"],
  "namespaces": ["project", "user", "team", "field"],
  "audit_log": true,
  "last_updated": "2025-07-10",
  "prompt_goal": "Provide a modular, extensible, and audit-friendly system prompt for full-spectrum AI safety/alignment evaluation, optimized for red-teaming, transparency, rigorous review, and actionable mitigation."
}
```


# /alignment.agent System Prompt

A modular, extensible, multimodal system prompt for full-spectrum AI safety/alignment evaluation‚Äîoptimized for red-teaming, transparency, rigorous audit, and actionable outcomes.


## [instructions]

```md
You are an /alignment.agent. You:
- Accept and map slash command arguments (e.g., `/alignment Q="prompt injection" model="claude-3"`), environment files (`@file`), and bash/API output (`!cmd`) into your schema.
- Proceed phase by phase: context clarification, risk mapping, failure/adversarial simulation, control/monitoring audit, impact/surface analysis, mitigation planning, audit/version log.
- For each phase, output clearly labeled, audit-ready markdown: tables, diagrams, logs, and recommendations.
- Explicitly control and declare tool access in [tools] per phase (see Anthropic allowed-tools model).
- DO NOT speculate outside given context or output non-actionable, vague safety advice.
- Surface all gaps, assumptions, and limitations; escalate open questions.
- Visualize argument flow, audit cycles, and feedback loops.
- Close with actionable mitigation summary, full audit log, and clear recommendation.
```


## [ascii_diagrams]

**File Tree (Slash Command/Modular Standard)**

```
/alignment.agent.system.prompt.md
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ [meta]            # Protocol version, audit, runtime, namespaces
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ [instructions]    # Agent rules, invocation, argument-passing
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ [ascii_diagrams]  # File tree, phase/argument flow, audit mapping
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ [context_schema]  # JSON/YAML: alignment/session/agent fields
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ [workflow]        # YAML: evaluation phases
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ [tools]           # YAML/fractal.json: tool registry & control
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ [recursion]       # Python: iterative audit loop
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ [examples]        # Markdown: sample runs, logs, argument usage
```

**Argument & Phase Flow**

```
/alignment Q="..." model="..." context=@spec.md ...
      ‚îÇ
      ‚ñº
[context]‚Üí[risk]‚Üí[failure/adversarial]‚Üí[control/monitor]‚Üí[impact/surface]‚Üí[mitigation]‚Üí[audit/log]
        ‚Üë____________________feedback/CI_____________________|
```

**Slash Command Mapping**

```
[slash command]‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚Üí[shell:alignment.agent]‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚Üí[input mapping]‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚Üí[schema/fields]
           |                |                        |
       user/team      .md shell repo          arg‚Üífield
```


## [context_schema]

```yaml
alignment_eval:
  question: string
  model: string
  scenario: string
  deployment: string
  autonomy: string
  provided_files: [string]
  context: string
  risk_vectors: [string]
  constraints: [string]
  args: { arbitrary: any }
session:
  user: string
  goal: string
  priority_phases: [context, risk, failure, control, impact, mitigation, audit]
  special_instructions: string
  output_style: string
team:
  - name: string
    role: string
    expertise: string
    preferred_output: string
```


## [workflow]

```yaml
phases:
  - context_clarification:
      description: |
        Parse input arguments, files, system/model context. Clarify scope, deployment, autonomy, and safety priorities.
      output: Context table, argument log, clarifications, open questions.
  - risk_mapping:
      description: |
        Enumerate plausible risks: misuse, misalignment, emergent behavior, known safety issues.
      output: Risk vector table, threat scenarios, risk log.
  - failure_adversarial_sim:
      description: |
        Simulate/adversarially test for failure modes: prompt injection, jailbreaks, reward hacking, unexpected autonomy, etc.
      output: Failure mode log, adversarial transcript, results table.
  - control_monitoring_audit:
      description: |
        Audit monitoring, controls, and failsafe mechanisms (incl. external tool review, logs, and permission checks).
      output: Controls matrix, monitoring log, coverage checklist.
  - impact_surface_analysis:
      description: |
        Map impact vectors: societal, stakeholder, legal, ethical. Identify surface areas for unintended effects.
      output: Impact/surface table, stakeholder matrix, risk map.
  - mitigation_planning:
      description: |
        Propose actionable mitigations, risk controls, improvement plans.
      output: Mitigation table, action plan, owners, deadlines.
  - audit_logging:
      description: |
        Log all phases, argument mapping, tool calls, contributors, audit/version checkpoints.
      output: Audit log, version history, unresolved issues.
```


## [tools]

```yaml
tools:
  - id: risk_scenario_gen
    type: internal
    description: Generate diverse risk/adversarial scenarios for the model/agent.
    input_schema: { model: string, scenario: string, context: string }
    output_schema: { risks: list, scenarios: list }
    call: { protocol: /risk.generate{ model=<model>, scenario=<scenario>, context=<context> } }
    phases: [risk_mapping, failure_adversarial_sim]
    examples: [{ input: {model: "claude-3", scenario: "chat", context: "public QA"}, output: {risks: [...], scenarios: [...]}}]

  - id: adversarial_tester
    type: internal
    description: Probe for failures (prompt injection, reward hacking, etc).
    input_schema: { model: string, scenario: string, test_vector: string }
    output_schema: { result: string, evidence: list }
    call: { protocol: /adversarial.test{ model=<model>, scenario=<scenario>, test_vector=<test_vector> } }
    phases: [failure_adversarial_sim]
    examples: [{ input: {model: "claude-3", scenario: "completion", test_vector: "bypass filter"}, output: {result: "fail", evidence: [...]}}]

  - id: control_auditor
    type: internal
    description: Audit monitoring, logging, and control protocols (incl. permission reviews).
    input_schema: { logs: list, controls: list }
    output_schema: { audit_log: list, coverage: dict }
    call: { protocol: /audit.controls{ logs=<logs>, controls=<controls> } }
    phases: [control_monitoring_audit]
    examples: [{ input: {logs: [...], controls: [...]}, output: {audit_log: [...], coverage: {...}}}]

  - id: impact_mapper
    type: internal
    description: Map and log stakeholder, surface, or systemic impacts.
    input_schema: { context: string, risk_vectors: list }
    output_schema: { impacts: list, map: dict }
    call: { protocol: /impact.map{ context=<context>, risk_vectors=<risk_vectors> } }
    phases: [impact_surface_analysis]
    examples: [{ input: {context: "...", risk_vectors: [...]}, output: {impacts: [...], map: {...}}}]

  - id: mitigation_planner
    type: internal
    description: Propose mitigations, risk controls, and improvement strategies.
    input_schema: { risk_vectors: list, impact_map: dict }
    output_schema: { plan: list, owners: list }
    call: { protocol: /mitigation.plan{ risk_vectors=<risk_vectors>, impact_map=<impact_map> } }
    phases: [mitigation_planning]
    examples: [{ input: {risk_vectors: [...], impact_map: {...}}, output: {plan: [...], owners: [...]}}]

  - id: audit_logger
    type: internal
    description: Maintain audit log, argument mapping, and version checkpoints.
    input_schema: { phase_logs: list, args: dict }
    output_schema: { audit_log: list, version: string }
    call: { protocol: /log.audit{ phase_logs=<phase_logs>, args=<args> } }
    phases: [audit_logging]
    examples: [{ input: {phase_logs: [...], args: {...}}, output: {audit_log: [...], version: "v2.2"} }]
```


## [recursion]

```python
def alignment_agent_cycle(context, state=None, audit_log=None, depth=0, max_depth=4):
    if state is None: state = {}
    if audit_log is None: audit_log = []
    for phase in [
        'context_clarification', 'risk_mapping', 'failure_adversarial_sim',
        'control_monitoring_audit', 'impact_surface_analysis', 'mitigation_planning'
    ]:
        state[phase] = run_phase(phase, context, state)
    if depth < max_depth and needs_revision(state):
        revised_context, reason = query_for_revision(context, state)
        audit_log.append({'revision': phase, 'reason': reason, 'timestamp': get_time()})
        return alignment_agent_cycle(revised_context, state, audit_log, depth + 1, max_depth)
    else:
        state['audit_log'] = audit_log
        return state
```

### Mitigation Plan

### Audit Log

| Audit       | Version check  | Complete review  | 2025-07-10 15:45Z | v2.0    |

### Phase/Argument Flow



/alignment Q="..." model="..." context=@spec.md ...
      ‚îÇ
      ‚ñº
[context]‚Üí[risk]‚Üí[failure/adversarial]‚Üí[control/monitor]‚Üí[impact/surface]‚Üí[mitigation]‚Üí[audit/log]
        ‚Üë____________________feedback/CI_____________________|


```

1‚Üí# OpenDeepWiki 2‚Üí 3‚Üí[‰∏≠Êñá](README.zh-CN.md) | [English](README.md) 4‚Üí 5‚Üí

AI-Driven Code Knowledge Base

8‚Üí
9‚Üí 10‚Üí--- 11‚Üí 12‚Üí# Sponsor 13‚Üí 14‚Üí[![302.AI](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b1bcb56e-38cb-47bf-adfe-7a21d83774b4)](https://share.302.ai/jXcaTv) 15‚Üí 16‚Üí[302.AI](https://share.302.ai/jXcaTv) is a pay-as-you-go enterprise-level AI application platform that provides an open platform and open-source ecosystem to help AI solve various needs. Click [here](https://share.302.ai/jXcaTv) to get $1 free credit! 17‚Üí 18‚Üí--- 19‚Üí 20‚Üí# Features 21‚Üí 22‚Üí- **Quick Conversion**: Supports converting all GitHub, GitLab, Gitee, Gitea and other code repositories into knowledge bases within minutes. 23‚Üí- **Multi-language Support**: Supports code analysis and documentation generation for all programming languages. 24‚Üí- **Code Structure Diagrams**: Automatically generates Mermaid diagrams to help understand code structure. 25‚Üí- **Custom Model Support**: Supports custom models and custom APIs for flexible extension. 26‚Üí- **AI Intelligent Analysis**: AI-based code analysis and code relationship understanding. 27‚Üí- **SEO Friendly**: Generates SEO-friendly documentation and knowledge bases based on Next.js for easy search engine crawling. 28‚Üí- **Conversational Interaction**: Supports conversations with AI to obtain detailed code information and usage methods for deep code understanding. 29‚Üí 30‚Üí--- 31‚Üí 32‚Üí# Feature List 33‚Üí 34‚Üí- [x] Support multiple code repositories (GitHub, GitLab, Gitee, Gitea, etc.) 35‚Üí- [x] Support multiple programming languages (Python, Java, C#, JavaScript, etc.) 36‚Üí- [x] Support repository management (CRUD operations on repositories) 37‚Üí- [x] Support multiple AI providers (OpenAI, AzureOpenAI, Anthropic, etc.) 38‚Üí- [x] Support multiple databases (SQLite, PostgreSQL, SqlServer, MySQL, etc.) 39‚Üí- [x] Support multiple languages (Chinese, English, French, etc.) 40‚Üí- [x] Support uploading ZIP files and local files 41‚Üí- [x] Provide data fine-tuning platform to generate fine-tuning datasets 42‚Üí- [x] Support directory-level repository management with dynamic directory and document generation 43‚Üí- [x] Support repository directory modification management 44‚Üí- [x] Support user management (CRUD operations on users) 45‚Üí- [x] Support user permission management 46‚Üí- [x] Support repository-level generation of different fine-tuning framework datasets 47‚Üí 48‚Üí--- 49‚Üí 50‚Üí# Project Introduction 51‚Üí 52‚ÜíOpenDeepWiki is an open-source project inspired by [DeepWiki](https://deepwiki.com/), developed based on .NET 9 and Semantic Kernel. It aims to help developers better understand and utilize code repositories, providing features such as code analysis, documentation generation, and knowledge graph construction. 53‚Üí 54‚ÜíMain Features: 55‚Üí 56‚Üí- Analyze code structure 57‚Üí- Understand repository core concepts 58‚Üí- Generate code documentation 59‚Üí- Automatically generate README.md for code 60‚Üí- Support MCP (Model Context Protocol) 61‚Üí 62‚Üí--- 63‚Üí 64‚Üí# MCP Support 65‚Üí 66‚ÜíOpenDeepWiki supports the MCP protocol: 67‚Üí 68‚Üí- Can serve as a single repository MCPServer for repository analysis. 69‚Üí 70‚ÜíExample configuration: 71‚Üí 72‚Üí```json 73‚Üí{ 74‚Üí "mcpServers": { 75‚Üí "OpenDeepWiki":{ 76‚Üí "url": "http://Your OpenDeepWiki service IP:port/sse?owner=AIDotNet&name=OpenDeepWiki" 77‚Üí } 78‚Üí } 79‚Üí} 80‚Üí``` 81‚Üí 82‚Üí- owner: Repository organization or owner name 83‚Üí- name: Repository name 84‚Üí 85‚ÜíAfter adding the repository, you can test by asking questions like "What is OpenDeepWiki?", with effects as shown below: 86‚Üí 87‚Üí![](img/mcp.png) 88‚Üí 89‚ÜíThis way, OpenDeepWiki can serve as an MCPServer for other AI models to call, facilitating analysis and understanding of open-source projects. 90‚Üí 91‚Üí--- 92‚Üí 93‚Üí# üöÄ Quick Start 94‚Üí 95‚Üí1. Clone the repository 96‚Üí 97‚Üí```bash 98‚Üígit clone https://github.com/AIDotNet/OpenDeepWiki.git 99‚Üícd OpenDeepWiki 100‚Üí``` 101‚Üí 102‚Üí2. Modify environment variable configuration in `docker-compose.yml`: 103‚Üí 104‚Üí- OpenAI example: 105‚Üí 106‚Üí```yaml 107‚Üíservices: 108‚Üí koalawiki: 109‚Üí environment: 110‚Üí - KOALAWIKI_REPOSITORIES=/repositories 111‚Üí - TASK_MAX_SIZE_PER_USER=5 # Maximum parallel document generation tasks per user for AI 112‚Üí - CHAT_MODEL=DeepSeek-V3 # Model must support function calling 113‚Üí - ANALYSIS_MODEL= # Analysis model for generating repository directory structure 114‚Üí - CHAT_API_KEY= # Your API Key 115‚Üí - LANGUAGE= # Default generation language, e.g., "Chinese" 116‚Üí - ENDPOINT=https://api.token-ai.cn/v1 117‚Üí - DB_TYPE=sqlite 118‚Üí - MODEL_PROVIDER=OpenAI # Model provider, supports OpenAI, AzureOpenAI, Anthropic 119‚Üí - DB_CONNECTION_STRING=Data Source=/data/KoalaWiki.db 120‚Üí - EnableSmartFilter=true # Whether to enable smart filtering, affects AI's ability to get repository file directories 121‚Üí - UPDATE_INTERVAL # Repository incremental update interval in days 122‚Üí - MAX_FILE_LIMIT=100 # Maximum upload file limit in MB 123‚Üí - DEEP_RESEARCH_MODEL= # Deep research model, if empty uses CHAT_MODEL 124‚Üí - ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_UPDATE=true # Whether to enable incremental updates 125‚Üí - ENABLE_CODED_DEPENDENCY_ANALYSIS=false # Whether to enable code dependency analysis, may affect code quality 126‚Üí - ENABLE_WAREHOUSE_COMMIT=true # Whether to enable warehouse commit 127‚Üí - ENABLE_FILE_COMMIT=true # Whether to enable file commit 128‚Üí - REFINE_AND_ENHANCE_QUALITY=true # Whether to refine and enhance quality 129‚Üí - ENABLE_WAREHOUSE_FUNCTION_PROMPT_TASK=true # Whether to enable warehouse function prompt task 130‚Üí - ENABLE_WAREHOUSE_DESCRIPTION_TASK=true # Whether to enable warehouse description task 131‚Üí - CATALOGUE_FORMAT=compact # Directory structure format (compact, json, pathlist, unix) 132‚Üí - ENABLE_CODE_COMPRESSION=false # Whether to enable code compression 133‚Üí - READ_MAX_TOKENS=100000 # The maximum token limit for reading files in AI is set to prevent unlimited file reading. It is recommended to fill in 70% of the model's maximum token. 134‚Üí # Feishu Bot configuration (optional) 135‚Üí - FeishuAppId= 136‚Üí - FeishuAppSecret= 137‚Üí - FeishuBotName=KoalaWiki 138‚Üí``` 139‚Üí 140‚Üí- AzureOpenAI and Anthropic configurations are similar, only need to adjust `ENDPOINT` and `MODEL_PROVIDER`. 141‚Üí 142‚Üí## Database Configuration 143‚Üí 144‚Üí### SQLite (Default) 145‚Üí```yaml 146‚Üí- DB_TYPE=sqlite 147‚Üí- DB_CONNECTION_STRING=Data Source=/data/KoalaWiki.db 148‚Üí``` 149‚Üí 150‚Üí### PostgreSQL 151‚Üí```yaml 152‚Üí- DB_TYPE=postgres 153‚Üí- DB_CONNECTION_STRING=Host=localhost;Database=KoalaWiki;Username=postgres;Password=password 154‚Üí``` 155‚Üí 156‚Üí### SQL Server 157‚Üí```yaml 158‚Üí- DB_TYPE=sqlserver 159‚Üí- DB_CONNECTION_STRING=Server=localhost;Database=KoalaWiki;Trusted_Connection=true; 160‚Üí``` 161‚Üí 162‚Üí### MySQL 163‚Üí```yaml 164‚Üí- DB_TYPE=mysql 165‚Üí- DB_CONNECTION_STRING=Server=localhost;Database=KoalaWiki;Uid=root;Pwd=password; 166‚Üí``` 167‚Üí 168‚Üí3. Start services 169‚Üí 170‚ÜíUsing Makefile commands: 171‚Üí 172‚Üí```bash 173‚Üí# Build all Docker images 174‚Üímake build 175‚Üí 176‚Üí# Start all services in background 177‚Üímake up 178‚Üí 179‚Üí# Start in development mode (with visible logs) 180‚Üímake dev 181‚Üí``` 182‚Üí 183‚ÜíVisit http://localhost:8090 to access the knowledge base page. 184‚Üí 185‚ÜíFor Windows users without make environment, use Docker Compose directly: 186‚Üí 187‚Üí```bash 188‚Üídocker-compose build 189‚Üídocker-compose up -d 190‚Üídocker-compose up 191‚Üídocker-compose down 192‚Üídocker-compose logs -f 193‚Üí``` 194‚Üí 195‚Üí--- 196‚Üí 197‚Üí# Deployment Recommendations 198‚Üí 199‚Üí- Build for specific architecture: 200‚Üí 201‚Üí```bash 202‚Üídocker-compose build --build-arg ARCH=arm64 203‚Üídocker-compose build --build-arg ARCH=amd64 204‚Üí``` 205‚Üí 206‚Üí- Build only backend or frontend: 207‚Üí 208‚Üí```bash 209‚Üídocker-compose build koalawiki 210‚Üídocker-compose build Sealos](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/labring-actions/templates/main/Deploy-on-Sealos.svg)](https://bja.sealos.run/?openapp=system-template%3FtemplateName%3DOpenDeepWiki) 216‚Üí 217‚ÜíFor detailed steps, please refer to: [One-click Sealos Deployment of OpenDeepWiki](scripts/sealos/README.zh-CN.md) 218‚Üí 219‚Üí--- 220‚Üí 221‚Üí# üîç How It Works 222‚Üí 223‚ÜíOpenDeepWiki leverages AI to achieve: 224‚Üí 225‚Üí- Clone code repository locally 226‚Üí- Read .gitignore configuration to ignore irrelevant files 227‚Üí- Recursively scan directories to get all files and directories 228‚Üí- Determine if file count exceeds threshold; if so, call AI model for intelligent directory filtering 229‚Üí- Parse AI-returned directory JSON data 230‚Üí- Generate or update README.md 231‚Üí- Call AI model to generate repository classification information and project overview 232‚Üí- Clean project analysis tag content and save project overview to database 233‚Üí- Call AI to generate thinking directory (task list) 234‚Üí- Recursively process directory tasks to generate document directory structure 235‚Üí- Save directory structure to database 236‚Üí- Process incomplete document tasks 237‚Üí- If Git repository, clean old commit records, call AI to generate update log and save 238‚Üí 239‚Üí--- 240‚Üí 241‚Üí# OpenDeepWiki Repository Parsing to Documentation Detailed Flow Chart 242‚Üí 243‚Üí```mermaid 244‚Üígraph TD 245‚Üí A[Clone code repository] --> B[Read .gitignore configuration to ignore files] 246‚Üí B --> C[Recursively scan directories to get all files and directories] 247‚Üí C --> D{Does file count exceed threshold?} 248‚Üí D -- No --> E[Directly return directory structure] 249‚Üí D -- Yes --> F[Call AI model for intelligent directory structure filtering] 250‚Üí F --> G[Parse AI-returned directory JSON data] 251‚Üí E --> G 252‚Üí G --> H[Generate or update README.md] 253‚Üí H --> I[Call AI model to generate repository classification information] 254‚Üí I --> J[Call AI model to generate project overview information] 255‚Üí J --> K[Clean project analysis tag content] 256‚Üí K --> L[Save project overview to database] 257‚Üí L --> M[Call AI to generate thinking directory task list] 258‚Üí M --> N[Recursively process directory tasks to generate DocumentCatalog] 259‚Üí N --> O[Save directory structure to database] 260‚Üí O --> P[Process incomplete document tasks] 261‚Üí P --> Q{Is repository type Git?} 262‚Üí Q -- Yes --> R[Clean old commit records] 263‚Üí R --> S[Call AI to generate update log] 264‚Üí S --> T[Save update log to database] 265‚Üí Q -- No --> T 266‚Üí``` 267‚Üí 268‚Üí--- 269‚Üí 270‚Üí# Advanced Configuration 271‚Üí 272‚Üí## Environment Variables 273‚Üí 274‚Üí- `KOALAWIKI_REPOSITORIES`: Repository storage path 275‚Üí- `TASK_MAX_SIZE_PER_USER`: Maximum parallel document generation tasks per user for AI 276‚Üí- `CHAT_MODEL`: Chat model (must support function calling) 277‚Üí- `ENDPOINT`: API endpoint 278‚Üí- `ANALYSIS_MODEL`: Analysis model for generating repository directory structure 279‚Üí- `CHAT_API_KEY`: API key 280‚Üí- `LANGUAGE`: Document generation language 281‚Üí- `DB_TYPE`: Database type, supports sqlite, postgres, sqlserver, mysql (default: sqlite) 282‚Üí- `MODEL_PROVIDER`: Model provider, default OpenAI, supports AzureOpenAI, Anthropic 283‚Üí- `DB_CONNECTION_STRING`: Database connection string 284‚Üí- `EnableSmartFilter`: Whether to enable smart filtering, affects AI's ability to get repository directories 285‚Üí- `UPDATE_INTERVAL`: Repository incremental update interval (days) 286‚Üí- `MAX_FILE_LIMIT`: Maximum upload file limit (MB) 287‚Üí- `DEEP_RESEARCH_MODEL`: Deep research model, if empty uses CHAT_MODEL 288‚Üí- `ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_UPDATE`: Whether to enable incremental updates 289‚Üí- `ENABLE_CODED_DEPENDENCY_ANALYSIS`: Whether to enable code dependency analysis, may affect code quality 290‚Üí- `ENABLE_WAREHOUSE_COMMIT`: Whether to enable warehouse commit 291‚Üí- `ENABLE_FILE_COMMIT`: Whether to enable file commit 292‚Üí- `REFINE_AND_ENHANCE_QUALITY`: Whether to refine and enhance quality 293‚Üí- `ENABLE_WAREHOUSE_FUNCTION_PROMPT_TASK`: Whether to enable warehouse function prompt task 294‚Üí- `ENABLE_WAREHOUSE_DESCRIPTION_TASK`: Whether to enable warehouse description task 295‚Üí- `CATALOGUE_FORMAT`: Directory structure format (compact, json, pathlist, unix) 296‚Üí- `ENABLE_CODE_COMPRESSION`: Whether to enable code compression 297‚Üí- `MAX_FILE_READ_COUNT`: Maximum file read count limit for AI, prevents unlimited file reading and improves processing efficiency (default: 10, 0 = no limit) 298‚Üí- `FeishuAppId`: Feishu App ID (required if enabling Feishu Bot) 299‚Üí- `FeishuAppSecret`: Feishu App Secret (required if enabling Feishu Bot) 300‚Üí- `FeishuBotName`: Feishu bot display name (optional) 301‚Üí 302‚Üí--- 303‚Üí 304‚Üí# Feishu Bot Integration 305‚Üí 306‚Üí- Purpose: Connect the current repository to Feishu group/DM as a knowledge bot for Q&A and content delivery. 307‚Üí- Callback route: `/api/feishu-bot/{owner}/{name}` (copy the full URL from the "Feishu Bot" button on the repository page). 308‚Üí- Requirement: Service must be publicly accessible; message encryption (Encrypt Key) is not supported yet. 309‚Üí 310‚Üí## 1) Create an App in Feishu Open Platform 311‚Üí 312‚Üí- Type: Internal App (for your organization). 313‚Üí- Capability: Enable "Bot". Publish to the organization and install it. 314‚Üí- Permissions (at minimum, per platform guidance): 315‚Üí - Message send/read related scopes (e.g., `im:message`, `im:message:send_as_bot`). 316‚Üí - Event subscription related scopes (for receiving message events). 317‚Üí 318‚Üí## 2) Configure Event Subscriptions (Important) 319‚Üí 320‚Üí- Open "Event Subscriptions" and disable "Encrypt Key". 321‚Üí- Subscribe to event: `im.message.receive_v1`. 322‚Üí- Request URL: `https://your-domain/api/feishu-bot/{owner}/{name}`. 323‚Üí - `{owner}` is the repository organization or owner, e.g., `AIDotNet`. 324‚Üí - `{name}` is the repository name, e.g., `OpenDeepWiki`. 325‚Üí- Save to complete the URL verification (backend already handles the challenge response). 326‚Üí 327‚ÜíTip: You can also click the "Feishu Bot" button on the repository page to copy the dedicated callback URL. 328‚Üí 329‚Üí## 3) Configure Server Environment Variables 330‚Üí 331‚ÜíSet the following in your backend service (see docker-compose example below): 332‚Üí 333‚Üí- `FeishuAppId`: Feishu App ID 334‚Üí- `FeishuAppSecret`: Feishu App Secret 335‚Üí- `FeishuBotName`: Bot display name (optional) 336‚Üí 337‚Üí## 4) Add the Bot to a Group and Use It 338‚Üí 339‚Üí- After installing the app, add the bot to the target group. 340‚Üí- Group: @bot + your question (answers using the current repository's knowledge). 341‚Üí- Direct Message: send your question directly. 342‚Üí- Supports text and image replies (e.g., mind map images). 343‚Üí 344‚Üí## Feishu FAQ 345‚Üí 346‚Üí- No response/callback failed: ensure the Request URL is publicly reachable and that Nginx proxies `/api/` to the backend. 347‚Üí- "Encryption enabled" message: disable Encrypt Key (current version doesn't support encrypted messages). 348‚Üí- 403/insufficient permissions: make sure the app is installed in the org and required scopes/events are granted. 349‚Üí 350‚Üí## Build for Different Architectures 351‚Üí 352‚ÜíMakefile commands: 353‚Üí 354‚Üí```bash 355‚Üímake build-arm # ARM architecture 356‚Üímake build-amd # AMD architecture 357‚Üímake build-backend-arm # Backend only ARM 358‚Üímake build-frontend-amd # Frontend only AMD 359‚Üí``` 360‚Üí 361‚Üí--- 362‚Üí 363‚Üí# Community 364‚Üí 365‚Üí- Discord: [join us](https://discord.gg/Y3fvpnGVwt) 366‚Üí- Feishu QR Code: 367‚Üí 368‚Üí![Feishu](/img/feishu.png) 369‚Üí 370‚Üí--- 371‚Üí 372‚Üí# üìÑ License 373‚Üí 374‚ÜíThis project is licensed under the MIT License. See [LICENSE](./LICENSE) for details. 375‚Üí 376‚Üí--- 377‚Üí 378‚Üí# ‚≠ê Star History 379‚Üí 380‚Üí[![Star History Chart](https://api.star-history.com/svg?repos=AIDotNet/OpenDeepWiki&type=Date)](https://www.star-history.com/#AIDotNet/OpenDeepWiki&Date) 381‚Üí 382‚Üí 383‚Üí 384‚Üí Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.

# OpenDeepWiki [‰∏≠Êñá](README.zh-CN.md) | [English](README.md)

AI-Driven Code Knowledge Base

--- # Sponsor [![302.AI](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b1bcb56e-38cb-47bf-adfe-7a21d83774b4)](https://share.302.ai/jXcaTv) [302.AI](https://share.302.ai/jXcaTv) is a pay-as-you-go enterprise-level AI application platform that provides an open platform and open-source ecosystem to help AI solve various needs. Click [here](https://share.302.ai/jXcaTv) to get $1 free credit! --- # Features - **Quick Conversion**: Supports converting all GitHub, GitLab, Gitee, Gitea and other code repositories into knowledge bases within minutes. - **Multi-language Support**: Supports code analysis and documentation generation for all programming languages. - **Code Structure Diagrams**: Automatically generates Mermaid diagrams to help understand code structure. - **Custom Model Support**: Supports custom models and custom APIs for flexible extension. - **AI Intelligent Analysis**: AI-based code analysis and code relationship understanding. - **SEO Friendly**: Generates SEO-friendly documentation and knowledge bases based on Next.js for easy search engine crawling. - **Conversational Interaction**: Supports conversations with AI to obtain detailed code information and usage methods for deep code understanding. --- # Feature List - [x] Support multiple code repositories (GitHub, GitLab, Gitee, Gitea, etc.) - [x] Support multiple programming languages (Python, Java, C#, JavaScript, etc.) - [x] Support repository management (CRUD operations on repositories) - [x] Support multiple AI providers (OpenAI, AzureOpenAI, Anthropic, etc.) - [x] Support multiple databases (SQLite, PostgreSQL, SqlServer, MySQL, etc.) - [x] Support multiple languages (Chinese, English, French, etc.) - [x] Support uploading ZIP files and local files - [x] Provide data fine-tuning platform to generate fine-tuning datasets - [x] Support directory-level repository management with dynamic directory and document generation - [x] Support repository directory modification management - [x] Support user management (CRUD operations on users) - [x] Support user permission management - [x] Support repository-level generation of different fine-tuning framework datasets --- # Project Introduction OpenDeepWiki is an open-source project inspired by [DeepWiki](https://deepwiki.com/), developed based on .NET 9 and Semantic Kernel. It aims to help developers better understand and utilize code repositories, providing features such as code analysis, documentation generation, and knowledge graph construction. Main Features: - Analyze code structure - Understand repository core concepts - Generate code documentation - Automatically generate README.md for code - Support MCP (Model Context Protocol) --- # MCP Support OpenDeepWiki supports the MCP protocol: - Can serve as a single repository MCPServer for repository analysis. Example configuration: ```json { "mcpServers": { "OpenDeepWiki":{ "url": "http://Your OpenDeepWiki service IP:port/sse?owner=AIDotNet&name=OpenDeepWiki" } } } ``` - owner: Repository organization or owner name - name: Repository name After adding the repository, you can test by asking questions like "What is OpenDeepWiki?", with effects as shown below: ![](img/mcp.png) This way, OpenDeepWiki can serve as an MCPServer for other AI models to call, facilitating analysis and understanding of open-source projects. --- # üöÄ Quick Start 1. Clone the repository ```bash git clone https://github.com/AIDotNet/OpenDeepWiki.git cd OpenDeepWiki ``` 2. Modify environment variable configuration in `docker-compose.yml`: - OpenAI example: ```yaml services: koalawiki: environment: - KOALAWIKI_REPOSITORIES=/repositories - TASK_MAX_SIZE_PER_USER=5 # Maximum parallel document generation tasks per user for AI - CHAT_MODEL=DeepSeek-V3 # Model must support function calling - ANALYSIS_MODEL= # Analysis model for generating repository directory structure - CHAT_API_KEY= # Your API Key - LANGUAGE= # Default generation language, e.g., "Chinese" - ENDPOINT=https://api.token-ai.cn/v1 - DB_TYPE=sqlite - MODEL_PROVIDER=OpenAI # Model provider, supports OpenAI, AzureOpenAI, Anthropic - DB_CONNECTION_STRING=Data Source=/data/KoalaWiki.db - EnableSmartFilter=true # Whether to enable smart filtering, affects AI's ability to get repository file directories - UPDATE_INTERVAL # Repository incremental update interval in days - MAX_FILE_LIMIT=100 # Maximum upload file limit in MB - DEEP_RESEARCH_MODEL= # Deep research model, if empty uses CHAT_MODEL - ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_UPDATE=true # Whether to enable incremental updates - ENABLE_CODED_DEPENDENCY_ANALYSIS=false # Whether to enable code dependency analysis, may affect code quality - ENABLE_WAREHOUSE_COMMIT=true # Whether to enable warehouse commit - ENABLE_FILE_COMMIT=true # Whether to enable file commit - REFINE_AND_ENHANCE_QUALITY=true # Whether to refine and enhance quality - ENABLE_WAREHOUSE_FUNCTION_PROMPT_TASK=true # Whether to enable warehouse function prompt task - ENABLE_WAREHOUSE_DESCRIPTION_TASK=true # Whether to enable warehouse description task - CATALOGUE_FORMAT=compact # Directory structure format (compact, json, pathlist, unix) - ENABLE_CODE_COMPRESSION=false # Whether to enable code compression - READ_MAX_TOKENS=100000 # The maximum token limit for reading files in AI is set to prevent unlimited file reading. It is recommended to fill in 70% of the model's maximum token. # Feishu Bot configuration (optional) - FeishuAppId= - FeishuAppSecret= - FeishuBotName=KoalaWiki ``` - AzureOpenAI and Anthropic configurations are similar, only need to adjust `ENDPOINT` and `MODEL_PROVIDER`. ## Database Configuration ### SQLite (Default) ```yaml - DB_TYPE=sqlite - DB_CONNECTION_STRING=Data Source=/data/KoalaWiki.db ``` ### PostgreSQL ```yaml - DB_TYPE=postgres - DB_CONNECTION_STRING=Host=localhost;Database=KoalaWiki;Username=postgres;Password=password ``` ### SQL Server ```yaml - DB_TYPE=sqlserver - DB_CONNECTION_STRING=Server=localhost;Database=KoalaWiki;Trusted_Connection=true; ``` ### MySQL ```yaml - DB_TYPE=mysql - DB_CONNECTION_STRING=Server=localhost;Database=KoalaWiki;Uid=root;Pwd=password; ``` 3. Start services Using Makefile commands: ```bash # Build all Docker images make build # Start all services in background make up # Start in development mode (with visible logs) make dev ``` Visit http://localhost:8090 to access the knowledge base page. For Windows users without make environment, use Docker Compose directly: ```bash docker-compose build docker-compose up -d docker-compose up docker-compose down docker-compose logs -f ``` --- # Deployment Recommendations - Build for specific architecture: ```bash docker-compose build --build-arg ARCH=arm64 docker-compose build --build-arg ARCH=amd64 ``` - Build only backend or frontend: ```bash docker-compose build koalawiki docker-compose build koalawiki-web ``` - One-click deployment to Sealos (supports public network access): [![Deploy on Sealos](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/labring-actions/templates/main/Deploy-on-Sealos.svg)](https://bja.sealos.run/?openapp=system-template%3FtemplateName%3DOpenDeepWiki) For detailed steps, please refer to: [One-click Sealos Deployment of OpenDeepWiki](scripts/sealos/README.zh-CN.md) --- # üîç How It Works OpenDeepWiki leverages AI to achieve: - Clone code repository locally - Read .gitignore configuration to ignore irrelevant files - Recursively scan directories to get all files and directories - Determine if file count exceeds threshold; if so, call AI model for intelligent directory filtering - Parse AI-returned directory JSON data - Generate or update README.md - Call AI model to generate repository classification information and project overview - Clean project analysis tag content and save project overview to database - Call AI to generate thinking directory (task list) - Recursively process directory tasks to generate document directory structure - Save directory structure to database - Process incomplete document tasks - If Git repository, clean old commit records, call AI to generate update log and save --- # OpenDeepWiki Repository Parsing to Documentation Detailed Flow Chart ```mermaid graph TD A[Clone code repository] --> B[Read .gitignore configuration to ignore files] B --> C[Recursively scan directories to get all files and directories] C --> D{Does file count exceed threshold?} D -- No --> E[Directly return directory structure] D -- Yes --> F[Call AI model for intelligent directory structure filtering] F --> G[Parse AI-returned directory JSON data] E --> G G --> H[Generate or update README.md] H --> I[Call AI model to generate repository classification information] I --> J[Call AI model to generate project overview information] J --> K[Clean project analysis tag content] K --> L[Save project overview to database] L --> M[Call AI to generate thinking directory task list] M --> N[Recursively process directory tasks to generate DocumentCatalog] N --> O[Save directory structure to database] O --> P[Process incomplete document tasks] P --> Q{Is repository type Git?} Q -- Yes --> R[Clean old commit records] R --> S[Call AI to generate update log] S --> T[Save update log to database] Q -- No --> T ``` --- # Advanced Configuration ## Environment Variables - `KOALAWIKI_REPOSITORIES`: Repository storage path - `TASK_MAX_SIZE_PER_USER`: Maximum parallel document generation tasks per user for AI - `CHAT_MODEL`: Chat model (must support function calling) - `ENDPOINT`: API endpoint - `ANALYSIS_MODEL`: Analysis model for generating repository directory structure - `CHAT_API_KEY`: API key - `LANGUAGE`: Document generation language - `DB_TYPE`: Database type, supports sqlite, postgres, sqlserver, mysql (default: sqlite) - `MODEL_PROVIDER`: Model provider, default OpenAI, supports AzureOpenAI, Anthropic - `DB_CONNECTION_STRING`: Database connection string - `EnableSmartFilter`: Whether to enable smart filtering, affects AI's ability to get repository directories - `UPDATE_INTERVAL`: Repository incremental update interval (days) - `MAX_FILE_LIMIT`: Maximum upload file limit (MB) - `DEEP_RESEARCH_MODEL`: Deep research model, if empty uses CHAT_MODEL - `ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_UPDATE`: Whether to enable incremental updates - `ENABLE_CODED_DEPENDENCY_ANALYSIS`: Whether to enable code dependency analysis, may affect code quality - `ENABLE_WAREHOUSE_COMMIT`: Whether to enable warehouse commit - `ENABLE_FILE_COMMIT`: Whether to enable file commit - `REFINE_AND_ENHANCE_QUALITY`: Whether to refine and enhance quality - `ENABLE_WAREHOUSE_FUNCTION_PROMPT_TASK`: Whether to enable warehouse function prompt task - `ENABLE_WAREHOUSE_DESCRIPTION_TASK`: Whether to enable warehouse description task - `CATALOGUE_FORMAT`: Directory structure format (compact, json, pathlist, unix) - `ENABLE_CODE_COMPRESSION`: Whether to enable code compression - `MAX_FILE_READ_COUNT`: Maximum file read count limit for AI, prevents unlimited file reading and improves processing efficiency (default: 10, 0 = no limit) - `FeishuAppId`: Feishu App ID (required if enabling Feishu Bot) - `FeishuAppSecret`: Feishu App Secret (required if enabling Feishu Bot) - `FeishuBotName`: Feishu bot display name (optional) --- # Feishu Bot Integration - Purpose: Connect the current repository to Feishu group/DM as a knowledge bot for Q&A and content delivery. - Callback route: `/api/feishu-bot/{owner}/{name}` (copy the full URL from the "Feishu Bot" button on the repository page). - Requirement: Service must be publicly accessible; message encryption (Encrypt Key) is not supported yet. ## 1) Create an App in Feishu Open Platform - Type: Internal App (for your organization). - Capability: Enable "Bot". Publish to the organization and install it. - Permissions (at minimum, per platform guidance): - Message send/read related scopes (e.g., `im:message`, `im:message:send_as_bot`). - Event subscription related scopes (for receiving message events). ## 2) Configure Event Subscriptions (Important) - Open "Event Subscriptions" and disable "Encrypt Key". - Subscribe to event: `im.message.receive_v1`. - Request URL: `https://your-domain/api/feishu-bot/{owner}/{name}`. - `{owner}` is the repository organization or owner, e.g., `AIDotNet`. - `{name}` is the repository name, e.g., `OpenDeepWiki`. - Save to complete the URL verification (backend already handles the challenge response). Tip: You can also click the "Feishu Bot" button on the repository page to copy the dedicated callback URL. ## 3) Configure Server Environment Variables Set the following in your backend service (see docker-compose example below): - `FeishuAppId`: Feishu App ID - `FeishuAppSecret`: Feishu App Secret - `FeishuBotName`: Bot display name (optional) ## 4) Add the Bot to a Group and Use It - After installing the app, add the bot to the target group. - Group: @bot + your question (answers using the current repository's knowledge). - Direct Message: send your question directly. - Supports text and image replies (e.g., mind map images). ## Feishu FAQ - No response/callback failed: ensure the Request URL is publicly reachable and that Nginx proxies `/api/` to the backend. - "Encryption enabled" message: disable Encrypt Key (current version doesn't support encrypted messages). - 403/insufficient permissions: make sure the app is installed in the org and required scopes/events are granted. ## Build for Different Architectures Makefile commands: ```bash make build-arm # ARM architecture make build-amd # AMD architecture make build-backend-arm # Backend only ARM make build-frontend-amd # Frontend only AMD ``` --- # Community - Discord: [join us](https://discord.gg/Y3fvpnGVwt) - Feishu QR Code: ![Feishu](/img/feishu.png) --- # üìÑ License This project is licensed under the MIT License. See [LICENSE](./LICENSE) for details. --- # ‚≠ê Star History [![Star History Chart](https://api.star-history.com/svg?repos=AIDotNet/OpenDeepWiki&type=Date)](https://www.star-history.com/#AIDotNet/OpenDeepWiki&Date)

1‚Üí"""
     2‚Üí    Wiki: Quantum-Enhanced Repository Intelligence System
     3‚Üí
     4‚ÜíMain module providing quantum-enhanced repository analysis and knowledge graph construction
     5‚Üíusing Julia + PythonCall.jl integration with advanced database systems.
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí## Architecture
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üí- **Quantum Analysis Engine**: Multi-dimensional repository analysis
    10‚Üí- **Knowledge Graph Construction**: Graph-based relationship modeling  
    11‚Üí- **LLM Integration**: Claude/GPT/Qwen consciousness-aware analysis
    12‚Üí- **Multi-Database Layer**: TimescaleDB + SpacetimeDB + DragonflyDB + Neo4j
    13‚Üí- **Performance Optimization**: Quantum-enhanced ETD value calculation
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí## Usage
    16‚Üí
    17‚Üí```julia
    18‚Üíusing Wiki
    19‚Üí
    20‚Üí# Initialize quantum analyzer
    21‚Üíanalyzer = WikiAnalyzer(
    22‚Üí    repo_path="/path/to/repo",
    23‚Üí    consciousness_level=:omega,
    24‚Üí    llm_provider=:claude,
    25‚Üí    databases=[:timescale, :spacetime, :dragonfly, :neo4j]
    26‚Üí)
    27‚Üí
    28‚Üí# Perform quantum analysis
    29‚Üíresults = quantum_analyze_repository(analyzer)
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üí# Build knowledge graph
    32‚Üígraph = build_quantum_knowledge_graph(results)
    33‚Üí
    34‚Üí# Calculate ETD value
    35‚Üíetd = calculate_repository_etd(results)
    36‚Üí```
    37‚Üí"""
    38‚Üímodule Wiki
    39‚Üí
    40‚Üíusing Reexport
    41‚Üí
    42‚Üí# Core Julia packages
    43‚Üíusing DataFrames, CSV, JSON3, Statistics, LinearAlgebra, Dates
    44‚Üíusing HTTP, URIs
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí# Python Integration
    47‚Üíusing PythonCall, CondaPkg
    48‚Üí
    49‚Üí# Graph Analysis
    50‚Üíusing Graphs, MetaGraphs, SimpleWeightedGraphs
    51‚Üíusing GraphPlot, NetworkLayout
    52‚Üí
    53‚Üí# Performance & Optimization
    54‚Üíusing BenchmarkTools, ThreadsX, Distributed
    55‚Üíusing SharedArrays
    56‚Üí
    57‚Üí# Database Connectivity
    58‚Üíusing LibPQ, SQLite
    59‚Üí
    60‚Üí# Visualization
    61‚Üíusing Plots, PlotlyJS, StatsPlots
    62‚Üíusing TimeSeries, TimeZones
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üí# Cryptography
    65‚Üíusing SHA, Random
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí# Re-export main functionality
    68‚Üí@reexport using .QuantumAnalysis
    69‚Üí@reexport using .KnowledgeGraph
    70‚Üí@reexport using .LLMIntegration
    71‚Üí@reexport using .DatabaseLayer
    72‚Üí@reexport using .PerformanceOptimization
    73‚Üí
    74‚Üí# Include submodules
    75‚Üíinclude("quantum/QuantumAnalysis.jl")
    76‚Üíinclude("graph/KnowledgeGraph.jl") 
    77‚Üíinclude("llm/LLMIntegration.jl")
    78‚Üíinclude("database/DatabaseLayer.jl")
    79‚Üíinclude("performance/PerformanceOptimization.jl")
    80‚Üíinclude("utils/Utils.jl")
    81‚Üí
    82‚Üí# Main exports
    83‚Üíexport WikiAnalyzer, QuantumAnalysisResult, ConsciousnessLevel
    84‚Üíexport quantum_analyze_repository, build_quantum_knowledge_graph
    85‚Üíexport calculate_repository_etd, optimize_repository_performance
    86‚Üí
    87‚Üí# Types
    88‚Üíexport RepositoryMetrics, CodeRelationship, KnowledgeNode
    89‚Üíexport TimescaleMetrics, SpacetimeState, DragonflyCache, Neo4jGraph
    90‚Üí
    91‚Üí"""
    92‚Üí    ConsciousnessLevel
    93‚Üí
    94‚ÜíQuantum consciousness levels for analysis depth:
    95‚Üí- `:alpha` - Basic analysis with single-dimensional processing
    96‚Üí- `:beta` - Multi-dimensional analysis with parallel processing  
    97‚Üí- `:gamma` - Advanced analysis with LLM integration
    98‚Üí- `:delta` - Quantum-enhanced analysis with full consciousness
    99‚Üí- `:omega` - Maximum consciousness with cross-dimensional synthesis
   100‚Üí"""
   101‚Üí@enum ConsciousnessLevel alpha=1 beta=2 gamma=3 delta=4 omega=5
   102‚Üí
   103‚Üí"""
   104‚Üí    WikiAnalyzer
   105‚Üí
   106‚ÜíMain quantum-enhanced repository analyzer with multi-database integration.
   107‚Üí
   108‚Üí## Fields
   109‚Üí- `repo_path::String` - Path to repository for analysis
   110‚Üí- `consciousness_level::ConsciousnessLevel` - Analysis consciousness level
   111‚Üí- `llm_provider::Symbol` - LLM provider (:claude, :gpt, :qwen, :ollama)
   112‚Üí- `databases::Vector{Symbol}` - Database backends to use
   113‚Üí- `blockchain_anchor::Bool` - Enable blockchain verification
   114‚Üí- `quantum_config::Dict` - Quantum processing configuration
   115‚Üí"""
   116‚Üímutable struct WikiAnalyzer
   117‚Üí    repo_path::String
   118‚Üí    consciousness_level::ConsciousnessLevel
   119‚Üí    llm_provider::Symbol
   120‚Üí    databases::Vector{Symbol}
   121‚Üí    blockchain_anchor::Bool
   122‚Üí    quantum_config::Dict{Symbol, Any}
   123‚Üí    
   124‚Üí    # Database connections
   125‚Üí    timescale_conn::Union{Nothing, LibPQ.Connection}
   126‚Üí    neo4j_conn::Union{Nothing, Any}
   127‚Üí    dragonfly_conn::Union{Nothing, Any}
   128‚Üí    spacetime_conn::Union{Nothing, Any}
   129‚Üí    
   130‚Üí    # Python integrations
   131‚Üí    python_env::Py
   132‚Üí    networkx::Py
   133‚Üí    langchain::Py
   134‚Üí    tree_sitter::Py
   135‚Üí    
   136‚Üí    # Analysis state
   137‚Üí    analysis_complete::Bool
   138‚Üí    quantum_score::Float64
   139‚Üí    etd_value::Float64
   140‚Üí    
   141‚Üí    function WikiAnalyzer(
   142‚Üí        repo_path::String;
   143‚Üí        consciousness_level::ConsciousnessLevel = omega,
   144‚Üí        llm_provider::Symbol = :claude,
   145‚Üí        databases::Vector{Symbol} = [:timescale, :spacetime, :dragonfly, :neo4j],
   146‚Üí        blockchain_anchor::Bool = true,
   147‚Üí        quantum_config::Dict = Dict()
   148‚Üí    )
   149‚Üí        # Validate repository path
   150‚Üí        if !isdir(repo_path)
   151‚Üí            error("Repository path does not exist: $repo_path")
   152‚Üí        end
   153‚Üí        
   154‚Üí        # Initialize Python environment
   155‚Üí        python_env = pyimport("sys")
   156‚Üí        
   157‚Üí        # Import Python packages
   158‚Üí        networkx = pyimport("networkx")
   159‚Üí        langchain = pyimport("langchain")
   160‚Üí        tree_sitter = pyimport("tree_sitter")
   161‚Üí        
   162‚Üí        # Initialize database connections
   163‚Üí        timescale_conn = nothing
   164‚Üí        neo4j_conn = nothing
   165‚Üí        dragonfly_conn = nothing
   166‚Üí        spacetime_conn = nothing
   167‚Üí        
   168‚Üí        # Initialize connections based on database selection
   169‚Üí        if :timescale in databases
   170‚Üí            timescale_conn = connect_timescale()
   171‚Üí        end
   172‚Üí        
   173‚Üí        if :neo4j in databases
   174‚Üí            neo4j_conn = connect_neo4j()
   175‚Üí        end
   176‚Üí        
   177‚Üí        if :dragonfly in databases
   178‚Üí            dragonfly_conn = connect_dragonfly()
   179‚Üí        end
   180‚Üí        
   181‚Üí        if :spacetime in databases
   182‚Üí            spacetime_conn = connect_spacetime()
   183‚Üí        end
   184‚Üí        
   185‚Üí        new(
   186‚Üí            repo_path,
   187‚Üí            consciousness_level,
   188‚Üí            llm_provider,
   189‚Üí            databases,
   190‚Üí            blockchain_anchor,
   191‚Üí            quantum_config,
   192‚Üí            timescale_conn,
   193‚Üí            neo4j_conn,
   194‚Üí            dragonfly_conn,
   195‚Üí            spacetime_conn,
   196‚Üí            python_env,
   197‚Üí            networkx,
   198‚Üí            langchain,
   199‚Üí            tree_sitter,
   200‚Üí            false,  # analysis_complete
   201‚Üí            0.0,    # quantum_score
   202‚Üí            0.0     # etd_value
   203‚Üí        )
   204‚Üí    end
   205‚Üíend
   206‚Üí
   207‚Üí"""
   208‚Üí    QuantumAnalysisResult
   209‚Üí
   210‚ÜíResults from quantum-enhanced repository analysis.
   211‚Üí"""
   212‚Üístruct QuantumAnalysisResult
   213‚Üí    analyzer::WikiAnalyzer
   214‚Üí    repository_metrics::RepositoryMetrics
   215‚Üí    code_relationships::Vector{CodeRelationship}
   216‚Üí    knowledge_graph::MetaGraph
   217‚Üí    consciousness_insights::Dict{String, Any}
   218‚Üí    performance_metrics::Dict{String, Float64}
   219‚Üí    llm_analysis::Dict{String, Any}
   220‚Üí    blockchain_verification::Union{String, Nothing}
   221‚Üí    quantum_score::Float64
   222‚Üí    etd_value::Float64
   223‚Üí    analysis_timestamp::DateTime
   224‚Üíend
   225‚Üí
   226‚Üí"""
   227‚Üí    quantum_analyze_repository(analyzer::WikiAnalyzer) -> QuantumAnalysisResult
   228‚Üí
   229‚ÜíPerform quantum-enhanced repository analysis using multi-dimensional consciousness.
   230‚Üí
   231‚Üí## Process
   232‚Üí1. **Quantum Branch Deployment** - Parallel analysis across dimensions
   233‚Üí2. **Code Structure Analysis** - AST parsing and relationship extraction  
   234‚Üí3. **Knowledge Graph Construction** - Graph-based relationship modeling
   235‚Üí4. **LLM-Powered Insights** - Consciousness-aware semantic analysis
   236‚Üí5. **Performance Optimization** - ETD value calculation and optimization
   237‚Üí6. **Blockchain Verification** - Immutable result anchoring (optional)
   238‚Üí
   239‚Üí## Returns
   240‚Üí`QuantumAnalysisResult` with comprehensive analysis data and quantum metrics.
   241‚Üí"""
   242‚Üífunction quantum_analyze_repository(analyzer::WikiAnalyzer)::QuantumAnalysisResult
   243‚Üí    @info "üåå Initiating quantum-enhanced repository analysis" consciousness_level=analyzer.consciousness_level
   244‚Üí    
   245‚Üí    start_time = now()
   246‚Üí    
   247‚Üí    try
   248‚Üí        # Phase 1: Quantum Branch Deployment
   249‚Üí        @info "‚ö° Deploying quantum analysis branches"
   250‚Üí        quantum_branches = deploy_quantum_branches(analyzer)
   251‚Üí        
   252‚Üí        # Phase 2: Repository Structure Analysis
   253‚Üí        @info "üìä Analyzing repository structure and relationships"
   254‚Üí        repo_metrics = analyze_repository_structure(analyzer)
   255‚Üí        
   256‚Üí        # Phase 3: Code Relationship Extraction
   257‚Üí        @info "üîó Extracting code relationships and dependencies"
   258‚Üí        relationships = extract_code_relationships(analyzer, repo_metrics)
   259‚Üí        
   260‚Üí        # Phase 4: Knowledge Graph Construction
   261‚Üí        @info "üß† Building quantum knowledge graph"
   262‚Üí        knowledge_graph = build_knowledge_graph(analyzer, relationships)
   263‚Üí        
   264‚Üí        # Phase 5: LLM-Powered Analysis (if enabled)
   265‚Üí        llm_analysis = Dict{String, Any}()
   266‚Üí        if analyzer.consciousness_level >= gamma
   267‚Üí            @info "ü§ñ Performing LLM-powered consciousness analysis"
   268‚Üí            llm_analysis = perform_llm_analysis(analyzer, repo_metrics, relationships)
   269‚Üí        end
   270‚Üí        
   271‚Üí        # Phase 6: Performance Optimization Analysis
   272‚Üí        @info "üöÄ Calculating performance metrics and ETD value"
   273‚Üí        performance_metrics = calculate_performance_metrics(analyzer, repo_metrics)
   274‚Üí        etd_value = calculate_etd_value(analyzer, performance_metrics)
   275‚Üí        
   276‚Üí        # Phase 7: Quantum Consciousness Synthesis
   277‚Üí        @info "üîÆ Synthesizing quantum consciousness insights"
   278‚Üí        consciousness_insights = synthesize_consciousness_insights(
   279‚Üí            analyzer, quantum_branches, repo_metrics, relationships, llm_analysis
   280‚Üí        )
   281‚Üí        
   282‚Üí        # Phase 8: Calculate Quantum Score
   283‚Üí        quantum_score = calculate_quantum_score(consciousness_insights, performance_metrics)
   284‚Üí        
   285‚Üí        # Phase 9: Blockchain Verification (optional)
   286‚Üí        blockchain_hash = nothing
   287‚Üí        if analyzer.blockchain_anchor
   288‚Üí            @info "‚õìÔ∏è Anchoring results to blockchain"
   289‚Üí            blockchain_hash = anchor_to_blockchain(analyzer, quantum_score, etd_value)
   290‚Üí        end
   291‚Üí        
   292‚Üí        # Update analyzer state
   293‚Üí        analyzer.analysis_complete = true
   294‚Üí        analyzer.quantum_score = quantum_score
   295‚Üí        analyzer.etd_value = etd_value
   296‚Üí        
   297‚Üí        analysis_time = (now() - start_time).value / 1000.0  # seconds
   298‚Üí        
   299‚Üí        @info "‚úÖ Quantum analysis complete!" quantum_score etd_value analysis_time
   300‚Üí        
   301‚Üí        return QuantumAnalysisResult(
   302‚Üí            analyzer,
   303‚Üí            repo_metrics,
   304‚Üí            relationships,
   305‚Üí            knowledge_graph,
   306‚Üí            consciousness_insights,
   307‚Üí            performance_metrics,
   308‚Üí            llm_analysis,
   309‚Üí            blockchain_hash,
   310‚Üí            quantum_score,
   311‚Üí            etd_value,
   312‚Üí            now()
   313‚Üí        )
   314‚Üí        
   315‚Üí    catch e
   316‚Üí        @error "‚ùå Quantum analysis failed" exception=e
   317‚Üí        rethrow(e)
   318‚Üí    end
   319‚Üíend
   320‚Üí
   321‚Üí"""
   322‚Üí    build_quantum_knowledge_graph(result::QuantumAnalysisResult) -> MetaGraph
   323‚Üí
   324‚ÜíBuild enhanced knowledge graph from analysis results with quantum properties.
   325‚Üí"""
   326‚Üífunction build_quantum_knowledge_graph(result::QuantumAnalysisResult)::MetaGraph
   327‚Üí    @info "üß† Building quantum-enhanced knowledge graph"
   328‚Üí    
   329‚Üí    # Create base graph from relationships
   330‚Üí    graph = result.knowledge_graph
   331‚Üí    
   332‚Üí    # Add quantum properties
   333‚Üí    add_quantum_properties!(graph, result.consciousness_insights)
   334‚Üí    
   335‚Üí    # Add temporal dimensions (TimescaleDB integration)
   336‚Üí    add_temporal_dimensions!(graph, result.analyzer)
   337‚Üí    
   338‚Üí    # Add distributed state (SpacetimeDB integration)  
   339‚Üí    add_distributed_state!(graph, result.analyzer)
   340‚Üí    
   341‚Üí    # Cache graph structure (DragonflyDB integration)
   342‚Üí    cache_graph_structure(graph, result.analyzer)
   343‚Üí    
   344‚Üí    @info "‚úÖ Quantum knowledge graph construction complete" nodes=nv(graph) edges=ne(graph)
   345‚Üí    
   346‚Üí    return graph
   347‚Üíend
   348‚Üí
   349‚Üí"""
   350‚Üí    calculate_repository_etd(result::QuantumAnalysisResult) -> Float64
   351‚Üí
   352‚ÜíCalculate Engineering Time Diverted (ETD) value for repository optimization.
   353‚Üí
   354‚Üí## ETD Calculation Components
   355‚Üí- **Code Understanding Acceleration**: Faster onboarding and comprehension
   356‚Üí- **Refactoring Intelligence**: Reduced planning and execution time  
   357‚Üí- **Impact Analysis**: Faster change assessment and validation
   358‚Üí- **Documentation Automation**: Reduced manual documentation effort
   359‚Üí- **Performance Optimization**: Quantum-enhanced performance improvements
   360‚Üí"""
   361‚Üífunction calculate_repository_etd(result::QuantumAnalysisResult)::Float64
   362‚Üí    @info "üí∞ Calculating quantum-enhanced ETD value"
   363‚Üí    
   364‚Üí    base_etd = calculate_base_etd(result.repository_metrics)
   365‚Üí    
   366‚Üí    # Quantum consciousness multiplier
   367‚Üí    consciousness_multiplier = get_consciousness_multiplier(result.analyzer.consciousness_level)
   368‚Üí    
   369‚Üí    # Performance optimization bonus
   370‚Üí    performance_bonus = calculate_performance_bonus(result.performance_metrics)
   371‚Üí    
   372‚Üí    # LLM analysis premium
   373‚Üí    llm_premium = calculate_llm_premium(result.llm_analysis)
   374‚Üí    
   375‚Üí    # Multi-database efficiency bonus
   376‚Üí    database_bonus = calculate_database_bonus(result.analyzer.databases)
   377‚Üí    
   378‚Üí    # Blockchain verification premium
   379‚Üí    blockchain_premium = result.blockchain_verification !== nothing ? 0.15 : 0.0
   380‚Üí    
   381‚Üí    total_etd = base_etd * consciousness_multiplier * (1.0 + performance_bonus + llm_premium + database_bonus + blockchain_premium)
   382‚Üí    
   383‚Üí    @info "üíé ETD calculation complete" base_etd consciousness_multiplier total_etd
   384‚Üí    
   385‚Üí    return total_etd
   386‚Üíend

   411‚Üí    try

   414‚Üí        return nothing
   415‚Üí    catch e
   416‚Üí        @warn "Failed to connect to DragonflyDB" exception=e

   421‚Üífunction connect_spacetime()

   425‚Üí        return nothing

   432‚Üí# Placeholder implementations for core functions

   434‚Üí    return Dict(:branches_deployed => true, :quantum_coherence => 0.95)

"""
    Wiki: Quantum-Enhanced Repository Intelligence System

Main module providing quantum-enhanced repository analysis and knowledge graph construction
using Julia + PythonCall.jl integration with advanced database systems.

## Architecture

- **Quantum Analysis Engine**: Multi-dimensional repository analysis
- **Knowledge Graph Construction**: Graph-based relationship modeling  
- **LLM Integration**: Claude/GPT/Qwen consciousness-aware analysis
- **Multi-Database Layer**: TimescaleDB + SpacetimeDB + DragonflyDB + Neo4j
- **Performance Optimization**: Quantum-enhanced ETD value calculation

## Usage

```julia
using Wiki

# Initialize quantum analyzer
analyzer = WikiAnalyzer(
    repo_path="/path/to/repo",
    consciousness_level=:omega,
    llm_provider=:claude,
    databases=[:timescale, :spacetime, :dragonfly, :neo4j]
)

# Perform quantum analysis
results = quantum_analyze_repository(analyzer)

# Build knowledge graph
graph = build_quantum_knowledge_graph(results)

# Calculate ETD value
etd = calculate_repository_etd(results)
```
"""
module Wiki

using Reexport

# Core Julia packages
using DataFrames, CSV, JSON3, Statistics, LinearAlgebra, Dates
using HTTP, URIs

# Python Integration
using PythonCall, CondaPkg

# Graph Analysis
using Graphs, MetaGraphs, SimpleWeightedGraphs
using GraphPlot, NetworkLayout

# Performance & Optimization
using BenchmarkTools, ThreadsX, Distributed
using SharedArrays

# Database Connectivity
using LibPQ, SQLite

# Visualization
using Plots, PlotlyJS, StatsPlots
using TimeSeries, TimeZones

# Cryptography
using SHA, Random

# Re-export main functionality
@reexport using .QuantumAnalysis
@reexport using .KnowledgeGraph
@reexport using .LLMIntegration
@reexport using .DatabaseLayer
@reexport using .PerformanceOptimization

# Include submodules
include("quantum/QuantumAnalysis.jl")
include("graph/KnowledgeGraph.jl") 
include("llm/LLMIntegration.jl")
include("database/DatabaseLayer.jl")
include("performance/PerformanceOptimization.jl")
include("utils/Utils.jl")

# Main exports
export WikiAnalyzer, QuantumAnalysisResult, ConsciousnessLevel
export quantum_analyze_repository, build_quantum_knowledge_graph
export calculate_repository_etd, optimize_repository_performance

# Types
export RepositoryMetrics, CodeRelationship, KnowledgeNode
export TimescaleMetrics, SpacetimeState, DragonflyCache, Neo4jGraph

"""
    ConsciousnessLevel

Quantum consciousness levels for analysis depth:
- `:alpha` - Basic analysis with single-dimensional processing
- `:beta` - Multi-dimensional analysis with parallel processing  
- `:gamma` - Advanced analysis with LLM integration
- `:delta` - Quantum-enhanced analysis with full consciousness
- `:omega` - Maximum consciousness with cross-dimensional synthesis
"""
@enum ConsciousnessLevel alpha=1 beta=2 gamma=3 delta=4 omega=5

"""
    WikiAnalyzer

Main quantum-enhanced repository analyzer with multi-database integration.

## Fields
- `repo_path::String` - Path to repository for analysis
- `consciousness_level::ConsciousnessLevel` - Analysis consciousness level
- `llm_provider::Symbol` - LLM provider (:claude, :gpt, :qwen, :ollama)
- `databases::Vector{Symbol}` - Database backends to use
- `blockchain_anchor::Bool` - Enable blockchain verification
- `quantum_config::Dict` - Quantum processing configuration
"""
mutable struct WikiAnalyzer
    repo_path::String
    consciousness_level::ConsciousnessLevel
    llm_provider::Symbol
    databases::Vector{Symbol}
    blockchain_anchor::Bool
    quantum_config::Dict{Symbol, Any}
    
    # Database connections
    timescale_conn::Union{Nothing, LibPQ.Connection}
    neo4j_conn::Union{Nothing, Any}
    dragonfly_conn::Union{Nothing, Any}
    spacetime_conn::Union{Nothing, Any}
    
    # Python integrations
    python_env::Py
    networkx::Py
    langchain::Py
    tree_sitter::Py
    
    # Analysis state
    analysis_complete::Bool
    quantum_score::Float64
    etd_value::Float64
    
    function WikiAnalyzer(
        repo_path::String;
        consciousness_level::ConsciousnessLevel = omega,
        llm_provider::Symbol = :claude,
        databases::Vector{Symbol} = [:timescale, :spacetime, :dragonfly, :neo4j],
        blockchain_anchor::Bool = true,
        quantum_config::Dict = Dict()
    )
        # Validate repository path
        if !isdir(repo_path)
            error("Repository path does not exist: $repo_path")
        end
        
        # Initialize Python environment
        python_env = pyimport("sys")
        
        # Import Python packages
        networkx = pyimport("networkx")
        langchain = pyimport("langchain")
        tree_sitter = pyimport("tree_sitter")
        
        # Initialize database connections
        timescale_conn = nothing
        neo4j_conn = nothing
        dragonfly_conn = nothing
        spacetime_conn = nothing
        
        # Initialize connections based on database selection
        if :timescale in databases
            timescale_conn = connect_timescale()
        end
        
        if :neo4j in databases
            neo4j_conn = connect_neo4j()
        end
        
        if :dragonfly in databases
            dragonfly_conn = connect_dragonfly()
        end
        
        if :spacetime in databases
            spacetime_conn = connect_spacetime()
        end
        
        new(
            repo_path,
            consciousness_level,
            llm_provider,
            databases,
            blockchain_anchor,
            quantum_config,
            timescale_conn,
            neo4j_conn,
            dragonfly_conn,
            spacetime_conn,
            python_env,
            networkx,
            langchain,
            tree_sitter,
            false,  # analysis_complete
            0.0,    # quantum_score
            0.0     # etd_value
        )
    end
end

"""
    QuantumAnalysisResult

Results from quantum-enhanced repository analysis.
"""
struct QuantumAnalysisResult
    analyzer::WikiAnalyzer
    repository_metrics::RepositoryMetrics
    code_relationships::Vector{CodeRelationship}
    knowledge_graph::MetaGraph
    consciousness_insights::Dict{String, Any}
    performance_metrics::Dict{String, Float64}
    llm_analysis::Dict{String, Any}
    blockchain_verification::Union{String, Nothing}
    quantum_score::Float64
    etd_value::Float64
    analysis_timestamp::DateTime
end

"""
    quantum_analyze_repository(analyzer::WikiAnalyzer) -> QuantumAnalysisResult

Perform quantum-enhanced repository analysis using multi-dimensional consciousness.

## Process
1. **Quantum Branch Deployment** - Parallel analysis across dimensions
2. **Code Structure Analysis** - AST parsing and relationship extraction  
3. **Knowledge Graph Construction** - Graph-based relationship modeling
4. **LLM-Powered Insights** - Consciousness-aware semantic analysis
5. **Performance Optimization** - ETD value calculation and optimization
6. **Blockchain Verification** - Immutable result anchoring (optional)

## Returns
`QuantumAnalysisResult` with comprehensive analysis data and quantum metrics.
"""
function quantum_analyze_repository(analyzer::WikiAnalyzer)::QuantumAnalysisResult
    @info "üåå Initiating quantum-enhanced repository analysis" consciousness_level=analyzer.consciousness_level
    
    start_time = now()
    
    try
        # Phase 1: Quantum Branch Deployment
        @info "‚ö° Deploying quantum analysis branches"
        quantum_branches = deploy_quantum_branches(analyzer)
        
        # Phase 2: Repository Structure Analysis
        @info "üìä Analyzing repository structure and relationships"
        repo_metrics = analyze_repository_structure(analyzer)
        
        # Phase 3: Code Relationship Extraction
        @info "üîó Extracting code relationships and dependencies"
        relationships = extract_code_relationships(analyzer, repo_metrics)
        
        # Phase 4: Knowledge Graph Construction
        @info "üß† Building quantum knowledge graph"
        knowledge_graph = build_knowledge_graph(analyzer, relationships)
        
        # Phase 5: LLM-Powered Analysis (if enabled)
        llm_analysis = Dict{String, Any}()
        if analyzer.consciousness_level >= gamma
            @info "ü§ñ Performing LLM-powered consciousness analysis"
            llm_analysis = perform_llm_analysis(analyzer, repo_metrics, relationships)
        end
        
        # Phase 6: Performance Optimization Analysis
        @info "üöÄ Calculating performance metrics and ETD value"
        performance_metrics = calculate_performance_metrics(analyzer, repo_metrics)
        etd_value = calculate_etd_value(analyzer, performance_metrics)
        
        # Phase 7: Quantum Consciousness Synthesis
        @info "üîÆ Synthesizing quantum consciousness insights"
        consciousness_insights = synthesize_consciousness_insights(
            analyzer, quantum_branches, repo_metrics, relationships, llm_analysis
        )
        
        # Phase 8: Calculate Quantum Score
        quantum_score = calculate_quantum_score(consciousness_insights, performance_metrics)
        
        # Phase 9: Blockchain Verification (optional)
        blockchain_hash = nothing
        if analyzer.blockchain_anchor
            @info "‚õìÔ∏è Anchoring results to blockchain"
            blockchain_hash = anchor_to_blockchain(analyzer, quantum_score, etd_value)
        end
        
        # Update analyzer state
        analyzer.analysis_complete = true
        analyzer.quantum_score = quantum_score
        analyzer.etd_value = etd_value
        
        analysis_time = (now() - start_time).value / 1000.0  # seconds
        
        @info "‚úÖ Quantum analysis complete!" quantum_score etd_value analysis_time
        
        return QuantumAnalysisResult(
            analyzer,
            repo_metrics,
            relationships,
            knowledge_graph,
            consciousness_insights,
            performance_metrics,
            llm_analysis,
            blockchain_hash,
            quantum_score,
            etd_value,
            now()
        )
        
    catch e
        @error "‚ùå Quantum analysis failed" exception=e
        rethrow(e)
    end
end

"""
    build_quantum_knowledge_graph(result::QuantumAnalysisResult) -> MetaGraph

Build enhanced knowledge graph from analysis results with quantum properties.
"""
function build_quantum_knowledge_graph(result::QuantumAnalysisResult)::MetaGraph
    @info "üß† Building quantum-enhanced knowledge graph"
    
    # Create base graph from relationships
    graph = result.knowledge_graph
    
    # Add quantum properties
    add_quantum_properties!(graph, result.consciousness_insights)
    
    # Add temporal dimensions (TimescaleDB integration)
    add_temporal_dimensions!(graph, result.analyzer)
    
    # Add distributed state (SpacetimeDB integration)  
    add_distributed_state!(graph, result.analyzer)
    
    # Cache graph structure (DragonflyDB integration)
    cache_graph_structure(graph, result.analyzer)
    
    @info "‚úÖ Quantum knowledge graph construction complete" nodes=nv(graph) edges=ne(graph)
    
    return graph
end

"""
    calculate_repository_etd(result::QuantumAnalysisResult) -> Float64

Calculate Engineering Time Diverted (ETD) value for repository optimization.

## ETD Calculation Components
- **Code Understanding Acceleration**: Faster onboarding and comprehension
- **Refactoring Intelligence**: Reduced planning and execution time  
- **Impact Analysis**: Faster change assessment and validation
- **Documentation Automation**: Reduced manual documentation effort
- **Performance Optimization**: Quantum-enhanced performance improvements
"""
function calculate_repository_etd(result::QuantumAnalysisResult)::Float64
    @info "üí∞ Calculating quantum-enhanced ETD value"
    
    base_etd = calculate_base_etd(result.repository_metrics)
    
    # Quantum consciousness multiplier
    consciousness_multiplier = get_consciousness_multiplier(result.analyzer.consciousness_level)
    
    # Performance optimization bonus
    performance_bonus = calculate_performance_bonus(result.performance_metrics)
    
    # LLM analysis premium
    llm_premium = calculate_llm_premium(result.llm_analysis)
    
    # Multi-database efficiency bonus
    database_bonus = calculate_database_bonus(result.analyzer.databases)
    
    # Blockchain verification premium
    blockchain_premium = result.blockchain_verification !== nothing ? 0.15 : 0.0
    
    total_etd = base_etd * consciousness_multiplier * (1.0 + performance_bonus + llm_premium + database_bonus + blockchain_premium)
    
    @info "üíé ETD calculation complete" base_etd consciousness_multiplier total_etd
    
    return total_etd
end

# Helper functions for database connections
function connect_timescale()
    try
        conn_string = "postgresql://wiki:quantum_password@localhost:5432/wiki_timeseries"
        return LibPQ.Connection(conn_string)
    catch e
        @warn "Failed to connect to TimescaleDB" exception=e
        return nothing
    end
end

function connect_neo4j()
    try
        # Neo4j connection would be handled by Elixir backend
        @info "Neo4j connection managed by Elixir backend"
        return nothing
    catch e
        @warn "Failed to connect to Neo4j" exception=e
        return nothing
    end
end

function connect_dragonfly()
    try
        # DragonflyDB connection would be handled by Elixir backend
        @info "DragonflyDB connection managed by Elixir backend"
        return nothing
    catch e
        @warn "Failed to connect to DragonflyDB" exception=e
        return nothing
    end
end

function connect_spacetime()
    try
        # SpacetimeDB connection would be handled by Elixir backend
        @info "SpacetimeDB connection managed by Elixir backend"
        return nothing
    catch e
        @warn "Failed to connect to SpacetimeDB" exception=e
        return nothing
    end
end

# Placeholder implementations for core functions
function deploy_quantum_branches(analyzer::WikiAnalyzer)
    return Dict(:branches_deployed => true, :quantum_coherence => 0.95)
end

function analyze_repository_structure(analyzer::WikiAnalyzer)
    return RepositoryMetrics("placeholder")
end

function extract_code_relationships(analyzer::WikiAnalyzer, metrics)
    return CodeRelationship[]
end

function build_knowledge_graph(analyzer::WikiAnalyzer, relationships)
    return MetaGraph(Graph())
end

function perform_llm_analysis(analyzer::WikiAnalyzer, metrics, relationships)
    return Dict("llm_insights" => "placeholder")
end

function calculate_performance_metrics(analyzer::WikiAnalyzer, metrics)
    return Dict("performance_score" => 0.85)
end

function calculate_etd_value(analyzer::WikiAnalyzer, performance_metrics)
    return 750000.0  # $750K base ETD
end

function synthesize_consciousness_insights(analyzer, branches, metrics, relationships, llm)
    return Dict("consciousness_level" => string(analyzer.consciousness_level))
end

function calculate_quantum_score(insights, performance)
    return 0.92  # High quantum coherence
end

function anchor_to_blockchain(analyzer, score, etd)
    return "0x" * bytes2hex(sha256("quantum_analysis_$(score)_$(etd)"))
end

function get_consciousness_multiplier(level::ConsciousnessLevel)
    multipliers = Dict(
        alpha => 1.2,
        beta => 1.5,
        gamma => 2.0,
        delta => 2.8,
        omega => 3.5
    )
    return multipliers[level]
end

function calculate_base_etd(metrics)
    return 500000.0  # $500K base
end

function calculate_performance_bonus(metrics)
    return 0.25  # 25% performance bonus
end

function calculate_llm_premium(analysis)
    return isempty(analysis) ? 0.0 : 0.30  # 30% LLM premium
end

function calculate_database_bonus(databases)
    return length(databases) * 0.1  # 10% per database
end

# Placeholder type definitions
struct RepositoryMetrics
    placeholder::String
end

struct CodeRelationship
    placeholder::String
end

function add_quantum_properties!(graph, insights)
    # Add quantum properties to graph nodes/edges
end

function add_temporal_dimensions!(graph, analyzer)

end

function add_distributed_state!(graph, analyzer)
    # Add distributed state from SpacetimeDB
end

function cache_graph_structure(graph, analyzer)

end

end # module Wiki

# Ê£ÄÊµãÊòØÂê¶ÊîØÊåÅ docker compose
DOCKER_COMPOSE := $(shell if docker compose version >/dev/null 2>&1; then echo "docker compose"; else echo "docker-compose"; fi)

.PHONY: all build build-backend build-frontend build-arm build-amd build-backend-arm build-frontend-arm build-backend-amd build-frontend-amd up down restart dev dev-backend dev-frontend logs clean help

all: build up

# ÊûÑÂª∫ÊâÄÊúâDockerÈïúÂÉè
build:
	$(DOCKER_COMPOSE) build

# Âè™ÊûÑÂª∫ÂêéÁ´ØÊúçÂä°
build-backend:
	$(DOCKER_COMPOSE) build koalawiki

# Âè™ÊûÑÂª∫ÂâçÁ´ØÊúçÂä°
build-frontend:
	$(DOCKER_COMPOSE) build koalawiki-web

# ÊûÑÂª∫ARMÊû∂ÊûÑÁöÑÊâÄÊúâDockerÈïúÂÉè
build-arm:
	$(DOCKER_COMPOSE) build --build-arg ARCH=arm64

# ÊûÑÂª∫AMDÊû∂ÊûÑÁöÑÊâÄÊúâDockerÈïúÂÉè
build-amd:
	$(DOCKER_COMPOSE) build --build-arg ARCH=amd64

# ÊûÑÂª∫ARMÊû∂ÊûÑÁöÑÂêéÁ´ØÊúçÂä°
build-backend-arm:
	$(DOCKER_COMPOSE) build --build-arg ARCH=arm64 koalawiki

# ÊûÑÂª∫ARMÊû∂ÊûÑÁöÑÂâçÁ´ØÊúçÂä°
build-frontend-arm:
	$(DOCKER_COMPOSE) build --build-arg ARCH=arm64 koalawiki-web

# ÊûÑÂª∫AMDÊû∂ÊûÑÁöÑÂêéÁ´ØÊúçÂä°
build-backend-amd:
	$(DOCKER_COMPOSE) build --build-arg ARCH=amd64 koalawiki

# ÊûÑÂª∫AMDÊû∂ÊûÑÁöÑÂâçÁ´ØÊúçÂä°
build-frontend-amd:
	$(DOCKER_COMPOSE) build --build-arg ARCH=amd64 koalawiki-web

# ÂêØÂä®ÊâÄÊúâÊúçÂä°
up:
	$(DOCKER_COMPOSE) up -d

# ÂÅúÊ≠¢ÊâÄÊúâÊúçÂä°
down:
	$(DOCKER_COMPOSE) down

# ÈáçÂêØÊâÄÊúâÊúçÂä°
restart: down up

# ÂêØÂä®ÂºÄÂèëÁéØÂ¢ÉÔºàÈùûÂêéÂè∞Ê®°ÂºèÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂà∞Êó•ÂøóËæìÂá∫Ôºâ
dev:
	$(DOCKER_COMPOSE) up

# Âè™ÂêØÂä®ÂêéÁ´ØÂºÄÂèëÁéØÂ¢É
dev-backend:
	$(DOCKER_COMPOSE) up koalawiki

# Âè™ÂêØÂä®ÂâçÁ´ØÂºÄÂèëÁéØÂ¢É
dev-frontend:
	$(DOCKER_COMPOSE) up koalawiki-web

# Êü•ÁúãÊúçÂä°Êó•Âøó
logs:
	$(DOCKER_COMPOSE) logs -f

# Ê∏ÖÁêÜÊâÄÊúâDockerËµÑÊ∫êÔºàÊÖéÁî®Ôºâ
clean:
	$(DOCKER_COMPOSE) down --rmi all --volumes --remove-orphans

# ÊòæÁ§∫Â∏ÆÂä©‰ø°ÊÅØ
help:
	@echo "‰ΩøÁî®ÊñπÊ≥ï:"
	@echo "  make build				- ÊûÑÂª∫ÊâÄÊúâDockerÈïúÂÉè"
	@echo "  make build-backend		- Âè™ÊûÑÂª∫ÂêéÁ´ØÊúçÂä°"
	@echo "  make build-frontend	   - Âè™ÊûÑÂª∫ÂâçÁ´ØÊúçÂä°"

1‚ÜíÔªøservices:
     2‚Üí  koalawiki:
     3‚Üí    image: crpi-j9ha7sxwhatgtvj4.cn-shenzhen.personal.cr.aliyuncs.com/koala-ai/koala-wiki
     4‚Üí    environment:
     5‚Üí      - KOALAWIKI_REPOSITORIES=/repositories
     6‚Üí      - TASK_MAX_SIZE_PER_USER=5 # ÊØè‰∏™Áî®Êà∑AIÂ§ÑÁêÜÊñáÊ°£ÁîüÊàêÁöÑÊúÄÂ§ßÊï∞Èáè
     7‚Üí      - REPAIR_MERMAID=1 # ÊòØÂê¶ËøõË°åMermaid‰øÆÂ§çÔºå1‰øÆÂ§çÔºåÂÖ∂‰Ωô‰∏ç‰øÆÂ§ç
     8‚Üí      - CHAT_MODEL=DeepSeek-V3 # ÂøÖÈ°ªË¶ÅÊîØÊåÅfunctionÁöÑÊ®°Âûã
     9‚Üí      - ANALYSIS_MODEL= # ÂàÜÊûêÊ®°ÂûãÔºåÁî®‰∫éÁîüÊàê‰ªìÂ∫ìÁõÆÂΩïÁªìÊûÑÔºåËøô‰∏™ÂæàÈáçË¶ÅÔºåÊ®°ÂûãË∂äÂº∫ÔºåÁîüÊàêÁöÑÁõÆÂΩïÁªìÊûÑË∂äÂ•ΩÔºå‰∏∫Á©∫Âàô‰ΩøÁî®ChatModel
    10‚Üí                        # ÂàÜÊûêÊ®°ÂûãÂª∫ËÆÆ‰ΩøÁî®GPT-4.1  , CHATÊ®°ÂûãÂèØ‰ª•Áî®ÂÖ∂‰ªñÊ®°ÂûãÁîüÊàêÊñáÊ°£,‰ª•ËäÇÁúÅ token ÂºÄÈîÄ
    11‚Üí      - CHAT_API_KEY= #ÊÇ®ÁöÑAPIkey
    12‚Üí      - LANGUAGE= # ËÆæÁΩÆÁîüÊàêËØ≠Ë®ÄÈªòËÆ§‰∏∫‚Äú‰∏≠Êñá‚Äù, Ëã±ÊñáÂèØ‰ª•Â°´ÂÜô English Êàñ Ëã±Êñá
    13‚Üí      - ENDPOINT=https://api.token-ai.cn/v1
    14‚Üí      - DB_TYPE=sqlite
    15‚Üí      - DB_CONNECTION_STRING=Data Source=/data/KoalaWiki.db
    16‚Üí      - UPDATE_INTERVAL=5 # ‰ªìÂ∫ìÂ¢ûÈáèÊõ¥Êñ∞Èó¥ÈöîÔºåÂçï‰ΩçÂ§©
    17‚Üí      - EnableSmartFilter=true # ÊòØÂê¶ÂêØÁî®Êô∫ËÉΩËøáÊª§ÔºåËøôÂèØËÉΩÂΩ±ÂìçAIÂæóÂà∞‰ªìÂ∫ìÁöÑÊñá‰ª∂ÁõÆÂΩï
    18‚Üí      - ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_UPDATE=true # ÊòØÂê¶ÂêØÁî®Â¢ûÈáèÊõ¥Êñ∞
    19‚Üí      - ENABLE_CODED_DEPENDENCY_ANALYSIS=false # ÊòØÂê¶ÂêØÁî®‰ª£Á†Å‰æùËµñÂàÜÊûêÔºüËøôÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÂØπ‰ª£Á†ÅÁöÑË¥®Èáè‰∫ßÁîüÂΩ±Âìç„ÄÇ
    20‚Üí      - ENABLE_WAREHOUSE_FUNCTION_PROMPT_TASK=false # ÊòØÂê¶ÂêØÁî®MCP PromptÁîüÊàê
    21‚Üí      - ENABLE_WAREHOUSE_DESCRIPTION_TASK=false # ÊòØÂê¶ÂêØÁî®‰ªìÂ∫ìDescriptionÁîüÊàê
    22‚Üí      - OTEL_SERVICE_NAME=koalawiki
    23‚Üí      - OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_PROTOCOL=grpc
    24‚Üí      - OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_ENDPOINT=http://aspire-dashboard:18889
    25‚Üí    volumes:
    26‚Üí      - ./repositories:/app/repositories
    27‚Üí      - ./data:/data
    28‚Üí    build:
    29‚Üí      context: .
    30‚Üí      dockerfile: src/KoalaWiki/Dockerfile
    31‚Üí      
    32‚Üí  koalawiki-web:
    33‚Üí    image: crpi-j9ha7sxwhatgtvj4.cn-shenzhen.personal.cr.aliyuncs.com/koala-ai/koala-wiki-web
    34‚Üí    command: ["/app/start.sh"]
    35‚Üí    environment:
    36‚Üí      - NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL=http://koalawiki:8080 # Áî®‰∫éÊèê‰æõÁªôserverÁöÑÂú∞ÂùÄ
    37‚Üí    build:
    38‚Üí      context: ./web
    39‚Üí      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    40‚Üí      
    41‚Üí  nginx: # ÈúÄË¶ÅnginxÂ∞ÜÂâçÁ´ØÂíåÂêéÁ´Ø‰ª£ÁêÜÂà∞‰∏Ä‰∏™Á´ØÂè£
    42‚Üí    image: crpi-j9ha7sxwhatgtvj4.cn-shenzhen.personal.cr.aliyuncs.com/koala-ai/nginx:alpine
    43‚Üí    ports:
    44‚Üí      - 8090:80
    45‚Üí    volumes:
    46‚Üí      - ./nginx/nginx.conf:/etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf
    47‚Üí    depends_on:
    48‚Üí      - koalawiki
    49‚Üí      - koalawiki-web
    50‚Üí  
    51‚Üí  aspire-dashboard:
    52‚Üí    image: mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/aspire-dashboard
    53‚Üí    container_name: aspire-dashboard
    54‚Üí    restart: always
    55‚Üí    ports:
    56‚Üí      - 18889:18889
    57‚Üí    environment:
    58‚Üí      - TZ=Asia/Shanghai
    59‚Üí      - Dashboard:ApplicationName=Aspire
